page.title: 03Seventy Years in Drayton(2)
page.content: We rented the house for thirty five years and bought it ten years ago. It is a very old house with heavy beams and a large inglenook chimney corner,with a bakers oven . There is a small slit window in the stairs which looks on to the road. The stairs are stone. Drayton is much different than it was when I was a child. Then the roads were rough and very muddy, but in the Summer there were clouds of dust. A man in the village was employed to scrape the mud from the roads in the Winter. He had a large scraper which he dragged from one side to the other, piling the mud at the side in heaps. When the road was mended they brought big heaps of stone and put them on the verges.
